data.title: Shows A-Z - curb your enthusiasm on hbo
data.text:
view all related dvds | view all related news | view all related listings

[07/17/24 - 10:23 AM]

HBO & Max Receives 91 Emmy Nominations

"True Detective: Night Country" received 19 nominations, the most of any limited or anthology series, followed by top nominated program "Hacks" with 17 nominations.

[03/26/24 - 09:42 AM]

Top Original Series on Discovery, HGTV, Food Network, Investigation Discovery and TLC Helped Drive Warner Bros. Discovery to Deliver a 40 Percent Share of Adult Viewing on Sunday, March 17

In addition, WBD's strong March 17 performance was bolstered by the HBO original series "Curb Your Enthusiasm."

[02/23/24 - 11:27 PM]

Development Update: Week of February 19-23

Updates include: Netflix eyes "Virgin River" prequel series; FOX gives presentation order to "Meet the Kumars"; and Olivia Munn cast in Jon Hamm-led "Your Friends and Neighbors" at Apple TV+.

[01/23/24 - 12:46 PM]

What's New on Max This February

Max announces programming coming to the platform this February, including the debut of the twelfth and final season of HBO Original "Curb Your Enthusiasm."

[01/11/24 - 10:01 AM]

Video: "Curb Your Enthusiasm" Season 12 - Official Trailer - Max

Don't be mad he's leaving, be mad he stayed so long.

[12/14/23 - 10:00 AM]

HBO Original Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm" Returns for Its Twelfth and Final Season February 4

New episodes will debut subsequent Sundays at the same time leading up to the series finale on April 7.

[12/06/23 - 11:00 AM]

Video: Max Releases Brand Spot Showcasing New Footage from Expansive 2024 HBO and Max Original Programming Lineup

"The Sympathizer," "Curb Your Enthusiasm," "Industry," "Jerrod Carmichael: Reality Show," "The Jinx - Part Two," "My Brilliant Friend," "Elizabeth," "The Franchise," "The Penguin," "Pretty Little Liars: Summer School," "Tokyo Vice," and "Hacks" are among the showcased projects.

[11/03/23 - 11:51 PM]

Development Update: Week of October 30-November 3

Updates include: Paramount details "Yellowstone" franchise's future; HBO, Max give target dates for originals; and "Chapelwaite," "Joe Pickett" and "Wellmania" among latest to get the axe.

[05/17/23 - 08:18 AM]

What's on Max: Launch Through June 2023

Max will launch with brand new originals "SmartLess: On the Road," "How to Create a Sex Scandal," "What Am I Eating? With Zooey Deschanel," "Gremlins: Secrets of the Mogwai," "Clone High," and documentary "Bama Rush," plus blockbuster hit "Shazam! Fury of the Gods."

[01/24/23 - 11:27 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, January 24

Updates include: Michael Cudlitz tapped as Lex Luthor in The CW's "Superman & Lois"; Troy Kotsur to visit HBO's "Curb Your Enthusiasm"; and Netflix's "American Primeval" rounds out cast.

[12/21/22 - 03:00 PM]

Video: New HBO Max Brand Spot Highlights Platform's Expansive 2023 Original Programming Lineup

This brand spot showcases new HBO Originals including drama series "The Last of Us," debuting January 15, limited series "White House Plumbers," debuting in March, and "The Idol," "True Detective: Night Country" and "Rain Dogs."

[08/23/22 - 10:00 AM]

HBO Renews "Curb Your Enthusiasm" for a Twelfth Season

"Larry outdoes himself season after season and always manages to come back when the audience needs him most. We're thrilled for him, Jeff Schaffer, and our phenomenal cast to continue making us laugh and cringe in equal measure," said Amy Gravitt.

[07/12/22 - 10:38 AM]

HBO/HBO Max Receive 140 Emmy Nominations, The Most of Any Network or Platform This Year

"Succession" received 25 nominations, including Outstanding Drama Series.

[04/11/22 - 11:33 PM]

Development Update: Monday, April 11

Updates include: Larry David confirms return of HBO's "Curb Your Enthusiasm"; Netflix cancels "On the Verge"; and Kai Yu Wu brings new "Casper" series to Peacock.

[02/16/22 - 11:55 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, February 16

Updates include: FOX eyes return of "So You Think You Can Dance" this summer; CBS orders comedy pilot "Rust Belt News"; and Casey Bloys gives massive status check on HBO and HBO Max series.

[02/16/22 - 11:08 AM]

Two-Part HBO Documentary "The Larry David Story" Debuts March 1

This insightful two-part documentary finds the 74-year-old sitting down with friend/director Larry Charles for a peek behind the proverbial curtain, as David gets candid about his personal and professional highs and lows.

[01/04/22 - 02:59 PM]

December Marks HBO Max's Most-Viewed Month Since Its Launch tn Terms of Hours Viewed

The streamer highlights its performance for the month of December.

[11/19/21 - 06:01 AM]

"The Matrix Resurrections," "And Just Like That...," "Station Eleven," "Finding Magic Mike," "Gossip Girl" Season 1 Finale and More Arrive on HBO Max This December

Other highlights include "Odo," "Summer Camp Island," "The Fungies" and "Beforeigners."

[10/13/21 - 10:01 AM]

Video: "Curb Your Enthusiasm" - Season 11 Official Trailer - HBO

The new season premieres Sunday, October 24 at 10:30/9:30c.

[09/28/21 - 10:00 AM]

HBO's "Curb Your Enthusiasm" Returns for Its Eleventh Season October 24

The comedy series continues to prove how seemingly trivial details of one's day-to-day life - a cold cup of coffee, a stained shirt, a missing toothbrush - can precipitate a catastrophic chain of events.

[09/23/21 - 07:47 AM]

"Dune," "The Many Saints of Newark," The Third Season of "Succession," and the Final Season of "Insecure" Arrive on HBO Max This October

Also on tap are the second season of romantic comedy anthology series "Love Life," the third season of "Selena + Chef," the three-part mini-series event "Aquaman: King of Atlantis," and the second season of the unscripted series "We're Here."

[09/19/21 - 07:37 PM]

Video: New HBO Max Brand Spot Features First Looks at Upcoming Programming "And Just Like That...," "Peacemaker," New Seasons of "Euphoria," "Insecure," and More

The spot also includes scenes from Warner Bros. films debuting in theaters and on HBO Max.

[08/23/21 - 08:00 AM]

HBO & HBO Max Fall Programming Overview

Highlights include new seasons of "Curb Your Enthusiasm," "Insecure," "Love Life," "Selena + Chef," "Succession" and "We're Here" in October.

[04/22/21 - 11:26 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, April 22

Updates include: Maya Erskine lands role on "Obi-Wan Kenobi" at Disney+; HBO's 1980s Lakers project continues to expand cast; and Richard Lewis to return to "Curb Your Enthuiasm."

[03/01/21 - 11:10 AM]

HBO Programming Overview - Spring 2021

The pay channel recaps its current and future offerings to date.

[02/21/21 - 06:01 PM]

Video: Coming Soon to HBO in 2021

"The Nevers," "Mare of Easttown," "Succession" Season 3, "Insecure" Season 5, "100 Foot Wave," "Tina," and more are coming soon to HBO.

[10/12/20 - 11:00 AM]

Celebrate "Curb Your Enthusiasm's" 20th Anniversary on HBO Max

Watch every iconic episode and laugh out loud to all your favorite Larry-isms by streaming all ten seasons on HBO Max.

[06/30/20 - 10:29 AM]

Hit HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm," Starring Larry David, Will Return for an Eleventh Season

Said David: "Believe me, I'm as upset about this as you are. One day I can only hope that HBO will come to their senses and grant me the cancellation I so richly deserve."

[01/15/20 - 12:00 PM]

HBO and Cinemax Programming Overview - WarnerMedia TCA Winter 2020

The company recaps its current and upcoming projects to date.

[12/11/19 - 10:00 AM]

"Curb Your Enthusiasm" Returns January 19, Exclusively On HBO

Larry David is back - as Larry David - stumbling through one faux-pas after another in an all-new season of the award-winning, hit comedy series.

[12/01/19 - 11:54 AM]

Video: "Curb Your Enthusiasm" Season 10 - Official Teaser - HBO

"Curb Your Enthusiasm" returns this January to the pay channel.

[05/02/19 - 11:36 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, May 2

Updates include: "This Is Us" creator Dan Fogelman signs massive overall deal with 20th; Jeff Tweedy to visit HBO's "Curb Your Enthusiasm"; and Raven Metzner inks overall with ABC Studios.

[01/09/19 - 11:48 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, January 9

Updates include: Hulu cancels Sarah Silverman's "I Love You, America"; CBS gives pilot order to "Evil"; and Travis Fimmel is the first to be cast in TNT's "Raised by Wolves."

[10/19/18 - 11:35 PM]

Development Update: Friday, October 19

Updates include: Netflix pulls the plug on "Marvel's Luke Cage"; Catalina Sandino Moreno to join Sophia Bush-led "Surveillance" at CBS; and FOX's "The Passage" adds recurring roles.

[10/04/18 - 12:15 PM]

HBO/Cinemax Programming Overview - Fall 2018

The company recaps its plans for the rest of the year and beyond.

[01/12/18 - 12:40 PM]

HBO/Cinemax Programming Overview - Winter 2018

The company recaps its plans for the rest of the year and beyond.

[12/14/17 - 10:00 AM]

Hit HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm," Starring Larry David, to Return for Its Tenth Season

Said Larry David, "As I've said many times, when one has the opportunity to annoy someone, one should do so."

[10/24/17 - 10:55 AM]

"Michelle Wolf: Nice Lady," The Rising Star's First Stand-Up Special, Debuts Dec. 2, Exclusively on HBO

Taped in August at Skirball Center in New York City, the exclusive presentation showcases her signature voice as she takes on a wide range of topics.

[09/15/17 - 09:08 AM]

Hit HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm," Starring Larry David, Returns for Its Ninth Season Oct. 1

Guest stars include Katie Aselton, Elizabeth Banks, Ed Begley, Jr., Carrie Brownstein, Bryan Cranston, Lauren Graham, Jimmy Kimmel, Nick Offerman, Nasim Pedrad, Elizabeth Perkins, June Diane Raphael, Andrea Savage, Damon Wayans, Jr., Steven Weber and Casey Wilson.

[07/26/17 - 03:10 PM]

HBO/Cinemax Programming Overview - Summer 2017

The company recaps its plans for the rest of the year and beyond.

[07/26/17 - 03:06 PM]

Hit HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm," Starring Larry David, Returns for Its Ninth Season Oct. 1

Guest stars this season include Elizabeth Banks, Ed Begley, Jr., Carrie Brownstein, Bryan Cranston, Lauren Graham, Jimmy Kimmel, Nick Offerman, Nasim Pedrad and Elizabeth Perkins.

[07/10/17 - 10:07 AM]

HBO Confirms Oct. 1 Debut for Season 9 of "Curb Your Enthusiasm"

The show brings back cast favorites Jeff Garlin, Susie Essman and JB Smoove, among many others.

[03/13/17 - 11:34 PM]

Development Update: Monday, March 13

Updates include: David Giuntoli, Poppy Montgomery to lead "Mission Control" for CBS; Marley Shelton cast in NBC's "Drama High"; and Jay Harrington books role on "S.W.A.T." at CBS.

[02/23/17 - 11:52 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, February 23

Updates include: Lauren Graham to lead "Linda from HR" for FOX; Josh Duhamel, Bokeem Woodbine to star in "Unsolved" at USA; and Lea Michele cast in ABC comedy pilot.

[01/14/17 - 09:01 AM]

HBO/Cinemax Programming Overview - Winter 2017

The company recaps its plans for the year to come and beyond.

[11/07/16 - 11:25 PM]

Development Update: Monday, November 7

Updates include: CBS eyes prequel series for "The Big Bang Theory"; Robert De Niro, Julianne Moore to star in Amazon series; and Sarah Stiles bound for Epix's "Get Shorty."

[10/25/16 - 11:24 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, October 25

Updates include: ABC trims "Notorious" order from 13 to 10 episodes; David Lyons, Beau Knapp to lead Netflix's "Seven Seconds"; and Cartoon Network gives third season to "We Bare Bears."

[06/14/16 - 09:51 AM]

Hit HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm," Starring Larry David, to Return for Its Ninth Season

Asked why he decided to come back, David said, "In the immortal words of Julius Caesar, 'I left, I did nothing, I returned.'"

[09/30/15 - 09:26 AM]

All Eight Seasons of "Curb Your Enthusiasm" on HBO Comedy Starting Tomorrow

All eight seasons are also currently available on HBO NOW and HBO GO.

[04/28/14 - 03:21 PM]

Yahoo Gives First Look at its New Video and Digital Content Programming

Yahoo today announced the first two original comedies in its new lineup of long-form shows.

[11/11/13 - 11:15 PM]

Development Update: Monday, November 11

Updates include: Comedy Central cancels "The Jeselnik Offensive"; Robert Kirkman books "Outcast" at Cinemax; and Salim Akil to lead "Mr. Director" at HBO.

[10/04/13 - 11:19 PM]

Development Update: Friday, October 4

Updates include: FOX asks for additional scripts of "Brooklyn Nine-Nine"; Harry Connick, Jr., Brad Garrett land comedy projects; and Justin Spitzer brings "The Money Pit" to NBC.

[08/13/13 - 10:01 AM]

NBC Salutes Comedy Treasures with "TV's Funniest of the Funniest: A Paley Center for Media Special" to Air Sept. 1

With 60 years of hilarious television show moments to choose from, the special focuses on the top 30 funniest moments in television history.

[08/06/13 - 02:12 PM]

New York Comedy Festival Announces 2013 Line-Up

Among the highlights: Larry David will engage in a conversation with David Steinberg on Sunday, November 10.

[05/22/13 - 11:18 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, May 22

Updates include: Billy Crystal's "The Comedians" lands at FX; Logan Marshall-Green to topline Cinemax's "Quarry"; and Emma Roberts to join FX's "American Horror Story: Coven."

[02/25/13 - 11:56 PM]

Development Update: Monday, February 25

Updates include: Laura Ramsey to lead "The Sixth Gun" at NBC; Christine Lahti boards "Beverly Hills Cop" at CBS; and Janet Montgomery to star in ABC's "Gothica."

[02/14/13 - 08:16 AM]

TV Land Debuts Unflinching Larry David Comedy, "Curb Your Enthusiasm," on February 16

The show will then settle into its regular timeslot of 2am ET/PT beginning Tuesday, February 19, where it will air daily.

[01/28/13 - 11:11 PM]

Development Update: Monday, January 28

Updates include: NBC orders an additional episode of "Chicago Fire"; Rob Corddry, Allison Janney land pilots; and The CW gives green light to two more dramas.

[01/05/13 - 11:01 AM]

TV Land at TCA: Larry W. Jones on Pilot Slate, Summer Schedule

"Hot in Cleveland," "The Exes" and "The Soul Man" will all air back-to-back this summer.

[09/24/12 - 08:14 AM]

HBO Receives 23 Primetime Emmy(R) Awards, the Most of Any Network This Year

"Game of Thrones" received 6 awards, tied for the most of any program, while "Game Change" received 5 awards.

[09/19/12 - 12:01 PM]

Andre Braugher, Connie Britton, Giancarlo Esposito, Michael J. Fox, Jon Hamm, Ron Howard, Lucy Liu, Julianna Margulies, Julianne Moore and Keifer Sutherland Announced as Additional Presenters for "The 64th Primetime Emmy(R) Awards"

The telecast will air live coast to coast this Sunday, September 23 at 8:00/7:00c.

[09/15/12 - 07:53 PM]

The 64th Primetime Creative Arts Emmys Winners

HBO took home 17 awards, followed by CBS with 13 and PBS with 11.

[09/13/12 - 11:06 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, September 13

Updates include: Malin Akerman in talks for ABC's "Trophy Wife"; Leslie Grossman joins USA's "Paging Dr. Freed"; and Jon Hamm, Michael Keaton join Larry David in HBO's "Clear History."

[08/23/12 - 03:16 PM]

ABC Family Continues Its Original Programming Momentum with New Pilot Production

The network has greenlit two new drama pilots, "The Fosters," from executive producer Jennifer Lopez, and "Socio," from executive producer Gavin Polone.

[08/20/12 - 03:20 PM]

Multiple Emmy and Golden Globe Winner Michael J. Fox Returns to Series Television on NBC with New Comedy Series

The single-camera series, which has a 22-episode commitment, will begin filming this year for a Fall 2013 premiere date.

[08/01/12 - 03:15 PM]

HBO at TCA: Rolling Stones Documentary, Larry David Movie on Tap

Plus: the network's executives on "Treme," "The Newsroom," "Game of Thrones," "The Corrections" and more!

[07/19/12 - 08:35 AM]

HBO Receives 81 Primetime Emmy(R) Nominations, The Most of Any Network This Year

"Hemingway & Gellhorn" led all HBO nominees with 15 nominations.

[06/28/12 - 08:46 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Greenlights Three New Series For 2013 Starring Stand-Up Comedians Amy Schumer And Anthony Jeselnik And "The Ben Show" Starring Ben Hoffman

"These three shows have one thing in common, and I dare viewers to watch every single episode to find out what it is," said Kent Alterman.

[03/06/12 - 07:31 AM]

Nominations for the Second Annual "The Comedy Awards" Announced

The annual event will be taped at New York City's Hammerstein Ballroom on Saturday, April 28 and will premiere Sunday, May 6 on the cable channel.

[12/20/11 - 11:27 AM]

Star-Studded Lineup Announced for "NBC's New Year's Eve With Carson Daly" on December 31

Drake, Jessie J, Blake Shelton, Cee Lo Green, Megan Hilty, The Roots and Tony Bennett are among those on tap for the annual event.

[12/07/11 - 10:08 AM]

2012 Writers Guild Awards Television, News, Radio, Promotional Writing, and Graphic Animation Nominees Announced

The winners will be honored at the 2012 Writers Guild Awards on Sunday, February 19, at simultaneous ceremonies in Los Angeles and New York.

[11/17/11 - 11:59 AM]

New ABC Family Original Series "Jane by Design" Set to Premiere Tuesday, January 3 at 9:00PM ET/PT

Erica Dasher, David Clayton Rogers), Nicholas Roux, Rowly Dennis, India De Beaufort, Meagan Tandy, Matthew Atkinson and Andie MacDowell star in the project.

[11/17/11 - 10:07 AM]

Legendary Comedians Sit Down With Showtime(R) - New Interview Series "Inside Comedy" To Premiere Thursday, January 26th at 11 PM ET/PT

David Steinberg and Steve Carell are behind the 10-part series, originally titled "Laughing Stock."

[11/09/11 - 10:58 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, November 9

Updates include: Piers Morgan departs "America's Got Talent"; "Anderson" gets a second season; and Matt Letscher, J.B. Smoove to get "Bent" for NBC.

[08/11/11 - 10:55 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, August 11

Updates include: Erica Durance to visit ABC's "Charlie's Angeles"; Comedy Central, FOX pass on pilots; and Jane Kaczmarek joins NBC's "Whitney."

[07/28/11 - 02:36 PM]

HBO/Cinemax 2011/2012 Programming Overview

A complete recap of all of the networks' programming highlights for the upcoming season.

[07/12/11 - 06:33 AM]

PBS Explores the Roots of Today's Biggest Television Hits in "America in Primetime" Premiering October 30

James L. Brooks, Larry David, Julianna Margulies, Mary Tyler Moore, Shonda Rhimes and Shawn Ryan are among the featured talent.

[06/20/11 - 07:47 AM]

Nickelodeon Celebrates The Fairly OddParents' 10th Anniversary With Live-Action TV Movie, "A Fairly Odd Movie: Grow Up, Timmy Turner!" Saturday, July 9, at 8 P.M. (ET/PT)

The movie, from series creator Butch Hartman, also features TV veterans Jason Alexander, Cheryl Hines and Steven Weber.

[06/15/11 - 12:51 PM]

"Curb Your Enthusiasm" Launches Eighth Season July 10 on HBO

The pay channel further details the new season, airing Sunday nights at 10:00/9:00c.

[05/13/11 - 10:45 PM]

Development Update: Friday, May 13

Updates include: HBO renews "Treme"; Gretchen Berg, Aaron Harberts to run ABC's "Good Christian Belles"; and Robert De Niro in talks for Bernie Madoff telefilm.

[04/13/11 - 05:34 AM]

ABC Family Picks Up One-Hour Scripted Drama "Jane By Design"

Andie MacDowell and newcomer Erica Dasher star in the project, formerly known as formerly "What Would Jane Do?"

[04/07/11 - 08:30 AM]

Diane Lane, Tim Robbins and James Gandolfini Star in HBO Films' "Cinema Verite," A Dramatic Look at the Making of the Groundbreaking Documentary "An American Family," Debuting April 23

The pay channel further details the original movie, which also stars Patrick Fugit, Kathleen Quinlan, Lolita Davidovich, Shanna Collins and Thomas Dekker.

[04/01/11 - 11:03 AM]

HBO Sets Summer Premieres: "True Blood" Returns June 26, "Curb Your Enthusiasm" on July 10 and "Entourage" on July 24

The pay channel confirms its summer return dates.

[03/22/11 - 12:14 PM]

NBC Announces Series Premiere of New NBC Comedy "The Paul Reiser Show" on April 14

The newcomer will replace "Perfect Couples" in the 8:30/7:30c slot.

[01/31/11 - 07:55 AM]

Logo Builds on Primetime Momentum With Five Development Projects Including Comedy Project Executive Produced by Sarah Silverman

Silverman is behind "Tig Has Friends," in which comedian Tig Notaro interviews the cast of a different TV show, movie or band every week.

[01/25/11 - 02:16 PM]

2010 Year in Review/2011 Year in Preview: HBO

A look at what's ahead on the cable channel, plus a recap of its 2010 ratings highlights.

[01/03/11 - 06:17 PM]

Development Update: Monday, January 3

Updates include: "Life Unexpected's" Liz Tigelaar signs with ABC Studios; J.B. Smoove to star in FOX project; and Warren Leight tackle medical ethics, also at FOX.

[12/17/10 - 11:13 AM]

Brian Austin Green and Harold Perrineau To Star in TBS Pilot of "The Wedding Band"

Peter Cambor and Derek Miller also star in the project, about "a group of guys who try to escape the stress and craziness of their lives by performing in a wedding band."

[11/11/10 - 01:23 PM]

Five Schools Have Been Named Finalists in "My School Pride Web Competition," Sponsored by NBC.com and Microsoft

From now until November 29, viewers can vote on which school will receive 25 HP All-in-One Windows 7 PCs.

"Melissa & Joey" Receives Episode Back Order to Complete First Season

Christine Taylor Stars in 'Farewell MR. Kringle' a Hallmark Channel Original Movie World Premiere December 4

HBO at TCA: "Entourage" to End Next Season, "Detective Agency" May Return

[06/11/10 - 05:47 PM]

Development Update: Friday, June 11

[05/27/10 - 11:26 AM]

WGN America Launches in Hd on DirecTV

[05/10/10 - 09:01 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Sizzles This Summer with All-New Series and Specials as Well as Returning Favorites

New additions include a Whitney Cummings stand-up special and another "Comedy Central Roast" in August.

Comedy Central(R) Announces 2010-2011 Development Slate

Oliver Stone and Bruce Wagner to Develop One Hour Dramatic Series for Epix

"Still Holding" explores "the colliding worlds of three disparate people in Los Angeles, and the violent consequences of love and betrayal, of holding on and letting go."

[04/20/10 - 11:07 AM]

HBO Renews Hit Comedy Series Curb Your Enthusiasm, Starring Larry David, for Eighth Season

"After much soul searching - and by the way, it was nowhere to be found - I have decided to do another season," said Larry David.

Jerry Seinfeld, Taraji P. Henson and Jon Hamm Among the First Celebrity Panelists to Join TV Guide Network's "Curb: The Discussion"

Live at the Paley Festival: HBO's "Curb Your Enthusiasm"

Development Update: Tuesday, February 2

2010 Writers Guild Awards Television, Radio, News, Promotional Writing, and Graphic Animation Nominees Announced

Development Update: Monday, November 16

Updates include: Justin Theroux to visit NBC's "Parks & Recreation"; ABC cuts "Romantically Challenged" to seven episodes; and Larry Charles books a new comedy at NBC.

[11/09/09 - 06:51 PM]

Development Update: Monday, November 9

Updates include: Michael Trucco joins USA's "Facing Kate"; Melissa George to visit FOX's "Lie to Me"; and Pam Grier to play Amanda Waller on The CW's "Smallville."

TV Guide Network and TV Land Acquire Exclusive Joint Basic Cable Rights to Award-Winning HBO Comedy Series "Curb Your Enthusiasm"
